newsitem.title: JAPAN: Matsushita, Mitsubishi to beam digital channels.
newsitem.headline: Matsushita, Mitsubishi to beam digital channels.

text.p: Matsushita Electric Industrial Co, Mitsubishi Corp and Mitsubishi Electronic Corp will each broadcast 12 channels on Japan's DirecTV when it launches digital satellite broadcasting in Japan this autumn, a DirecTV spokesman said on Monday.
The three firms hold stakes in DirecTV Japan, along with Hughes Electronics Corp of the United States.
Matsushita will beam channels through its subsidiary, a Matsushita spokesman said.
Three other shareholders, including Dai Nippon Printing Co Ltd, have also obtained rights to broadcast 12 channels, DirecTV said.
DirecTV will start beaming 100 digital channels in Japan in the autumn in head-to-head competition with Japan Sky Broadcasting or JSkyB.
JSkyB is a joint venture between media tycoon Rupert Murdoch's News Corp and Japan's Softbank Corp.
Jiji news agency on Monday quoted Softbank president Masayoshi Son as saying that Softbank, Japan's Sony Corp and News Corp have basically agreed to a partnership and to invest equally in JSkyB.
